metadata.title: CVE-2021-47121 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: net:caif: fix memory leak in cfusbl_device_notify In case of caif_enroll_dev()fail, allocated link_support won't be assigned to the correspondingstructure. So simply free allocated pointer in case of error.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-47121` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-154-generic - 4.15.0-154.161
linux-image-4.15.0-154-generic-lpae - 4.15.0-154.161
linux-image-4.15.0-154-lowlatency - 4.15.0-154.161
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-154-generic - 4.15.0-154.161
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-154-lowlatency - 4.15.0-154.161
No subscription required

linux-image-5.4.0-81-generic - 5.4.0-81.91~18.04.1
linux-image-5.4.0-81-generic-lpae - 5.4.0-81.91~18.04.1
linux-image-5.4.0-81-lowlatency - 5.4.0-81.91~18.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-81-generic - 5.4.0-81.91~18.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-81-lowlatency - 5.4.0-81.91~18.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1098-kvm - 4.15.0-1098.100
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1110-aws - 4.15.0-1110.117
No subscription required

linux-image-5.4.0-1055-aws - 5.4.0-1055.58~18.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1122-azure - 4.15.0-1122.135
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1056-azure - 5.4.0-1056.58~18.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1107-gcp - 4.15.0-1107.121
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1051-gcp - 5.4.0-1051.55~18.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1010-ibm - 5.4.0-1010.11~18.04.2
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1079-oracle - 4.15.0-1079.87
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-154.161').
linux-hwe: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'replaced by linux-hwe-5.4').
linux-hwe-5.4 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.4.0-81.91~18.04.1').
